data.title: Samsung Galaxy S6 Price in Nigeria 2024, Full Specs & Review
data.meta_description: The latest updated Samsung Galaxy S6 official, unofficial price in Nigeria 2024 and full specifications, News and Review at TechTalks.com.ng
data.meta_site_name: Tech Talks - Your Gateway to the Future of Technology
data.text:
Last Updated on July 27, 2024 by TechTalks

The Samsung Galaxy S6 was a flagship smartphone released in 2015 that introduced several innovative features for its time, including a premium glass and metal design, improved camera, and wireless charging capabilities. Though no longer Samsung’s latest model, the Galaxy S6 remains popular in the Nigerian market as an affordable option for those seeking a reliable Android device with solid performance. This article examines the current pricing and specifications of the Samsung Galaxy S6 in Nigeria, providing an overview of what buyers can expect when considering this older but still capable smartphone.

Samsung Galaxy S6 Main Features

Samsung Galaxy S6 Current Price in Nigeria 2024

The price range for a new Samsung Galaxy S6 in Nigeria is approximately ₦150,000 to ₦190,000, depending on the storage capacity and condition. Used Galaxy S6 devices can be found for lower prices, typically ranging from ₦85,000 to ₦130,000, based on the phone’s condition and seller.

Samsung Galaxy S6 Full Specifications

The Samsung Galaxy S6 features a 5.1-inch Quad HD Super AMOLED display, 16 MP rear camera with optical image stabilization, 3 GB of RAM, and an Exynos 7420 octa-core processor. It runs on Android OS (upgradable to Android 7.0 Nougat) and includes a 2550 mAh battery with fast charging capabilities. The device also supports wireless charging and features a fingerprint sensor.

Body Design

Hardware & Software

Battery

Connectivity

Other Features

Conclusion

The Samsung Galaxy S6 remains a viable option for budget-conscious consumers in Nigeria seeking a reliable smartphone with decent specifications. While it may not compete with the latest flagship models, its competitive pricing in the used market makes it an attractive choice for those who prioritize value. The device’s solid build quality, capable camera, and still-respectable performance ensure it can handle most everyday tasks efficiently. However, potential buyers should consider factors such as battery life and the lack of expandable storage when deciding. Overall, the Galaxy S6 continues to offer a balanced mix of features and affordability in the Nigerian smartphone market 2024.

Samsung Galaxy S6 FAQs

Is the Samsung Galaxy S6 still a good phone in 2024?

While not cutting-edge, the Galaxy S6 can still handle basic tasks well. It’s suitable for users with modest needs who prioritize affordability over having the latest features.

Can the Samsung Galaxy S6 be upgraded to the latest Android version?

No, the Galaxy S6’s last official update was to Android 7.0 Nougat. It cannot be upgraded to newer Android versions officially.

Does the Samsung Galaxy S6 support 4G in Nigeria?

Yes, the Galaxy S6 supports 4G LTE networks in Nigeria, allowing for faster internet speeds where 4G is available.

Is the Samsung Galaxy S6 battery removable?

No, the Galaxy S6 has a non-removable battery. This was a significant change from previous Galaxy S models.

Can I expand the storage on the Samsung Galaxy S6?

No, the Galaxy S6 does not have a microSD card slot for expandable storage. Users must rely on internal storage and cloud services.
